text:
A donor has decided to build an aquarium in town. The donor wants lots of tanks with large colorful fish to make the aquarium exciting and inviting. The donor will pay for all materials and upkeep.

A team of students (you and your classmates) has been invited to help design these tanks. You will need to build a model that can help the donor determine the appropriate size of the tanks for many different situations.

Important information

  • Fish need space to swim
  • Tanks need air space at the top to account for waves and to stop fish from escaping
  • Tanks should include rocks (about 15-20% of the tank) at the bottom, plants, and other decorations
  • Fish need clean water in order to breathe
  • Each tank will likely contain different amounts, and types, of fish

The donorâ€™s suggested assumptions

  • Fish are different sizes, but you can assume for now that all the fish in a tank will be the same size
  • Fish are 3D, but their size can be approximated either using weight or length

Two popular water guidelines

  • 1 gallon of water per inch of fish, or
  • 6-10 gallons of water per pound of fish
